title: Unitary, constitutional, and dual executive Iran

content.question: Which description below most accurately describes Iranâ€™s Islamic republic?

choices.label: A federal government with a single executive and a bicameral legislature
A federal government with a dual executive served by a large bureaucracy
A unitary government with a dual executive whose power and duties are formally derived from the military
A unitary government with a dual executive whose powers are constitutionally divided along party lines
A unitary government with a dual executive whose prerogatives and responsibilities are specified in the Constitution

content.answer: A unitary government with a dual executive whose prerogatives and responsibilities are specified in the Constitution

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors of a course country.
